thread.title: Kylie Jenner, 19, calls fans 'f idiots'
thread.title_full: Kylie Jenner, 19, calls fans 'f idiots' | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.com Reporter
title: Kylie Jenner, 19, calls fans 'f idiots'
text:
Kylie Jenner has lashed out at fans who accused her of trying to make her waxwork lookalike darker skinned than she is in real life.
The teen posted Snapchats on Wednesday as she was photographed and measured for her doppelganger and also shared an image of colors being mixed on a palette to match her skin tone.
'I'm not trying to make my wax figure darker than I am, you f idiots,' she lambasted her social media followers.
Scroll down for video
Hit back at her social media followers: Kylie Jenner called her fans 'f idiots' for suggesting that she was trying to make her waxwork's skin color darker than hers is in real life
Mix and match: The criticisms poured in after the teen reality star shared images on Snapchat of the color palette being used to match her skin tone for the waxwork of her that's being made
'They were mixing all those colors on a palette, not me. Stop reaching!' the reality star, 19, added.
'I don't even have say in this so let's leave it to the professionals, people!'
Kylie stood on a white sheet with a platform on top while photographers took photos of her every angle to ensure they get the dimensions just right for the waxwork figure.
She wore figure-hugging gray workout shorts grey shorts and a lighter gray sports bra that struggled to contain her very amble bosom.
Documented: Kylie stood on a white sheet with a platform on top while photographers took photos of her every angle to ensure they get the dimensions just right for the waxwork figure
Measuring moment: She wore grey biking shorts that clung tightly to her body and a lighter grey sports bra so the photographers would have accurate dimensions to work with
She also wore high heels and had a full face of makeup including her signature matte lips.
Despite recently cutting off all her natural hair, the young star had a full head of extensions that gave her hair that fell almost to her waist.
She explained in her Snapchat clips that it takes about six months from the initial measurements to completion.
The video then showed Kylie with green dots all over her face to get the exact look of her facial features, although the Keeping Up With The Kardashian star put her own filter on her face to distort the way she really looks.
In a thank you note to Madame Tussaud's, she revealed her wax figure will live in the Hollywood museum on Hollywood Blvd. in Los Angeles.
Kylieâ€™s older half-sister Kim Kardashian and her younger sister Kendall Jenner both already have their own wax figures on display.
Details! The video then showed the teen with green dots all over her face to get the exact look of her facial features, although she altered the way she looks with a Snapchat filter
Gratitude: In a thank you note to Madame Tussaud's, she revealed her wax figure will live in the Hollywood museum in Los Angeles
